message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.AR

The paper discusses the use of media-based modulation (MBM) in wireless communication systems, which involves altering the far-field radiation pattern of reconfigurable antennas to convey information. This topic falls under the field of information theory (cs.IT) and networked systems (cs.NI), as well as multimedia (cs.MM) and systems and control (cs.SY) due to the use of reconfigurable antennas. Additionally, the paper discusses the potential for MBM in augmented reality (cs.AR) applications.
